events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 9th, requesting to file a claim for the damages sustained.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a vehicle collision reported in the initial filing.
An insurance agent specializing in auto accident claims was assigned to manage the investigation and guide the customer through the process.
The claim was formally acknowledged by the company, and the claimant was contacted with next steps within the same day.
Request for submitting the vehicle repair estimate, photos of the damage, and police accident report was sent to the customer to proceed.
The customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos of the collision damage and a copy of the accident police report.
Investigation began to verify the claim details, inspect the submitted documents, and evaluate the damage from the reported car accident.
The investigation concluded successfully with confirmation of the claim validity and estimates matching the damage reported by the customer.
A settlement offer was made to cover the vehicle repair costs less deductible, and the customer was informed about the proposed amount.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the handling of the claim process so far.
Following customer acceptance of the settlement, the claim was officially approved for payment to proceed immediately.
The payment for the approved settlement amount was issued and confirmation was sent to the customer on the same day.
The claim was formally closed after confirmation that the payment was received and the customer expressed no further concerns.
All claim documents and records were archived according to company policy for future reference and auditing purposes.
